name: Hyatt Place Ft. Lauderdale 17th Street Convention Center

reviews.text: affordable, nice and clean hotel; location is very convenient, literally on 17th street, close to the airport, cruise port and shopping; I had a suite and it was as expected, showed on the web; gym is small but functional; the wetaher was too cold so did not use pool, but it looked fine and looked after; will reccommned for short stays, when most of the time out of hotel...
reviews.title: nothing fancy but nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the thing I love about Hyatt Place is the consistancy between each property. We have stayed in a few and I know what to expect, courteous service, clean comfy room, great breakfast! The courtesy shuttle was a bonus when we took a taxi back and had to go retreive our car the next day. Staff was all very nice. We love the room we have to relax.
reviews.title: very nice....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a pre-cruise night at the Hyatt Place and it was very acceptable and it worked very well. The rooms were clean and the sitting area was very nice particularly after a long flight. The hotel is an easy walk to Total Wine and Publix if you want some food or drinks. We also went to a restaurant in the same area and it was perfect. The breakfast at the hotel was adequate and it was very typical for this type of hotel. If you are expecting a grand dining experience, this is not it but if you are going to a cruise and you will be eating immediately upon arrival, this breakfast will take care of you.
reviews.title: A great place for a pre-cruise

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hyatt Place On March 22 before a cruise. Staff was very nice and the rooms were clean and roomy. The pool needed to be cleaned but we did not have time to use it. The Harbor Shops are a block away so very convenient for pre cruise shopping. The Publix was open till 11:00 PM so we went there after dinner at Duffy's. Excellent place for dinner or lunch. Was surprised that the Hyatt Place does not recognize gold members of Hyatt that was my only complant. We chose to take the shuttle for $7.00 pp in the morning and it was a pleasure. Last year stayed at the Embassy Suites across the street and the place was a nightmare. You will be happy staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice place pre cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed night before cruise. Typical Hyatt Place but seemed newer. Arrived after 11 pm so airport shuttle was no longer running. Cab ride was around $15 from airport. Hotel is walking distance to Total Wine and Publix. Is also within walking distance to restaurants but at the late hour we were there (11:30 pm) it did seem kind of dark and unsafe to walk. In the morning the manager called us a cab to the port which arrived promptly and was less expensive than the transfers.
reviews.title: Perfect for Night Before Cruise

reviews.text: Checked in late after taking the ferry from the Bahamas. Nice room. Wifi wasn't great. We were hoping to swim, but the pool closed at 10. Hotel doesn't offer room service, had to order food and go downstairs to pick it up. Breakfast started at 6am - perfect as we had an early flight. Airport shuttle doesn't start until 7am so we had to take a cab to the airport (around $12).
reviews.title: Served it's purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the least expensive hotel we stayed at on our Florida vacation (Ft. Lauderdale to Key West) but it was the nicest. We were there only one night and it served its purpose. The staff was helpful when we got a room with only one double bed when we had booked two queens.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable and Reasonably Priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's really a business hotel, but it's within easy driving distance to the beach. The parking at the beach wasn't bad either. The free continental breakfast was excellent!
reviews.title: Good Night's Stay

reviews.text: This is a very decent hotel for spending a night or two. We stay in Ft Lauderdale near the beach a couple times a year and have tried quite a few in the area in the similar price range and a lot of them are getting kind of shabby, but here the room was spacious and very clean with modern furniture and a nice bathroom. The sectional pull out couch area and wet bar area with sink and fridge ( in a king room) was a nice touch. Bed was comfortable. ( Parking here is only $5 - most places charge in the $20 range. The staff at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful. Lots of restaurants and stores in the area and the beach is a short drive away. No complaints. I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Busy with small bed

reviews.text: Booked for two nights before a cruise. Arrived at night to find us booked into a ground floor handicapped room with double bed rather than queen which we had requested. Bed sagged badly and husband spent two nights on hideabed. Overpowering room freshener odor caused nausea and needed bathroom fan to be left on all night. MUSAK outside in hall was disturbing until front desk was asked to shut it off at 1am.
reviews.title: Great little spot!

reviews.text: Very good location in south Ft. Lauderdale, one block from a shopping mall with restaurants, grocery, bars, shops, etc. Numerous restaurants within walking distance. The 17th St causeway leads straight out to the beach. Close to the airport and the hotel has complimentary airport shuttle. For cruisers there is also a shuttle available to the piers. Neighborhood was quiet and clean. This is a 'Hyatt Place', meaning not a full service hotel, but not a problem. Complimentary breakfast was fine, Starbucks coffee included. The room was clean, shower hot, staff accomodating. Internet was complimentary but did not work the first night. The room could easily sleep 3 as the sofa folded out. We obtained a nice rate by booking early and pre-paying. This is a fine alternative if attending a meeting, departing on cruise, etc.
reviews.title: just the facts ma'am
Very comfortable room, friendly staff
reviews.text: We stayed here post-cruise and were very happy with the room and the location. We left too early to take advantage of the free breakfast. No free 24 hour shuttle, so budget for the cab fare. Do take note of the shuttle costs from the cruise port to the hotel. We would stay here again.

I often stay at Hyatt Place properties and enjoy the large, nicely-furnished rooms with the classic high-quality mattreses for which Hyatt is known. This property is off a busy east-west street (SE 17th Street) which leads to the beach area and is very convenient to Port Everglades, FLL airport and Route 1 and I-95. All the staff (well, maybe not the younger guy on the overnight shift) including housekeepers seemed genuinely friendly and anxious to help.
reviews.title: Well-located, nicely-staffed

reviews.text: A couple of things to note that aren't deal-breakers but you should know: the nicely-maintained pool doesn't get much morning or late afternoon sun * proximity to the port means that there are a lot of transient guests there for one-night either coming from or going to a cruise who obviously don't get out much (take that for whatever you wish) * the hot items on the breakfast buffet were obviously selected by corporate types who never have to eat them after deciding others will (great coffee, though).
reviews.title: Convenient but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The courtesy shuttle between the hotel and the airport was very popular. Even though I didn't use it, it was apparent that reservations are necessary in both directions unless you want to wait until space is available after those who did reserve.
reviews.title: Read the fine print!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an odd place - can not think it was original designed as an hotel.
reviews.title: OK I guess

reviews.text: To start with, as has previously been noted the lobby is more like a coffee shop than reception area - was not sure if I was at the cash desk or check in. Having said that, I had asked for, and got a very early check in having just come from a cruise.
reviews.title: Average hotel, but very convenient to Port Everglades

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very large but oddly configured, more than half was taken up by a sitting area comprising a sofa bed, a 2 seater sofa and a double size ottoman/pouffe. Guess 6 or 7 adults could have been comfortably accommodated. However, because of the half screen between here and the bed (the bed being by the window) this area was very dark.The kingsize bed was reasonable comfortable and the bedlinen good quality but unironed. Do not understand why the hotel does not have laundry finished. I like to get into a bed that appears clean and fresh.
reviews.title: good hotel good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping ok but did not do rooms until after 3.30 - guess this is because priority always on preparing rooms after check out. Did not always replenish tea & coffee supplies. There is medium size frig.
reviews.title: No Service to be had - Bad Sign
Good hotel. Terrible shuttle service
reviews.text: There was no bath but large shower. As is often the case the hand towel was not big enough to dry hair on.

Stayed at the Hyatt Place prior to departing on a cruise. Excellent location near a large shopping plaza to gather last minute supplies and wine (within a 5 minute walk from the hotel). There are also numerous restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Rooms are large and well appointed. Breakfast was good, but given the volume of cruisers heading out early the dining area was very full but there is an overflow room to the right of the elevators. We have small children so we took advantage of the outdoor pool while waiting for the shuttle to the ship - pool was clean and and warmer than expected. Shuttle service to the Port was excellent - just be sure to book your trip over when checking in.
reviews.title: Excellent Pre-Cruise Accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel. It is convenient to the port, to the airport, and to the beaches of Ft Lauderdale. The hotel is very well run. Rooms are nicely done; housekeeping is excellent and the morning breakfast is good. Parking is convenient. The staff is helpful and enthusiastic. Restaurants are plentiful - and walkable.
reviews.title: This hotel is an excellent choice

reviews.text: You will be pleased you made this hotel choice.
reviews.title: Over charged!

reviews.text: There were 23 of us booked 5 rooms at this hotel through hotel planner web site and all prepaid for the rooms. This was my sister first time booking the rooms. She didn't realized hotel planners charged $100 more than what other website charged. 3 weeks after we came back from our trip. Hyatt charged all our credit cards for the rooms eventhough the receipt balance was zero when we checked out. I really mean they charged all 5 rooms on all the credit cards that we gave them when we check in. We had to fight with 3 different companies to get our money back. Make sure you always check your credit card thoroughly after coming back from your vacation.
reviews.title: A very good stay...

reviews.text: We have stayed here a few times pre-cruise and love the convenient location to Port Everglades, nice restaurants, and shopping. The very large rooms with many conveniences are a bonus, too. Self served breakfast in great, with nice choices, if not a little crowded at times. Staff were friendly and helpful, and helped us with transport to the port when our pre-arranged cab did not show up. Our 2 night stay could not have been better. Only downside is that on a weekend in March, the price tends to hurt the pocketbook.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, Good pre-cruise, too pricey

reviews.text: We stayed here with a group of 26 before going on a cruise and I can not say enough great things about this hotel. Half of us arrived on Friday evening and the other half arrived on a red eye fly flight from Las Vegas early Saturday morning. When we arrived at the hotel on 7:00 AM Saturday morning after flying on a very cramped flight over night we were exhausted. We arrived at the hotel to drop our bags off and get breakfast and wait for check-in and were pleasantly surprised that there were rooms available and we were able to check-in. I can not say enough thanks for letting us into our rooms early as we were in desperate need of sleep. The rooms are huge, the beds were comfortable and the location is close to restaurants, bars, shops and the beach. Couldn't ask for me for a great price. Thanks again Hyatt Place 17th Street Convention Center, you ROCK!!!!
reviews.title: Could not ask for a better stay

reviews.text: Was a bit shocked when first arrived and thought reception was a shop or cafe but first impressions deceived as this was a very pleasant and friendly hotel. The room was excellent, very large even by American standards with a large sofa(extra bed) area utility sink and fridge in one part of the room and two queen beds and a sink vanity area in the other with en suite bath/shower and wc. Excellent large screen tv with a good package of entertainment.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel well situated near shops and restaurants and close to the cruise terminal which seems to provide a lot of their business - me included. Taxi from port was just 10$ but the hotel does have shuttles. Breakfast buffet style, not a massive range but perfectly fine. Would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Simply outstanding
Highly recommend for off the beach relaxing
reviews.text: The good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a bit strange in how its set up but it worked for me. Very comfortable. The TV was huge and tons of HD channels.Very clean. I really liked how they have a desk, refrigerator, in room coffee, and wet bar on the side. the bed was great and the ac nice and quiet. This particular hotel is in an area close to everything (cruise port, airport, beaches, downtown ft lauderdale) and the area is safe. But best of all, the staff was very welcoming and everyone always smiled and said hi. My hats off to the staff. Also, the breakfast was nice.
reviews.title: Clean and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here one night post cruise. Ran into several other people from the ship who always stay here. First time for us in this hotel but would certainly come back.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Located within a few minutes drive of both the cruise port and the airport. We arrived well ahead of normal check in time and the staff was overrun with guests checking out. Nonetheless we received a warm and friendly welcome and were assured they could have a room ready for us in half an hour. Seemed fine with us as we felt the need for a glass of wine. As we were relaxing some friends joined us for a glass and sure enough within 30 minutes or so we were advised that our room was ready.
reviews.title: Disappointed!

reviews.text: The room was very clean and quite a bit larger than we anticipated. Internet access was flawless.
reviews.title: Nice Post Cruise

reviews.text: Publix, Total Wine and several restaurants were within easy walking distance. Staff were all extremely accommodating and outgoing. Shuttle to the airport was on time, driver was great.
reviews.title: Pre and Post Cruise Gem

reviews.text: Not sure we would stay in this location if we were vacationing in Ft. Lauderdale for a week or two, but for a traveller passing through it's a perfect place to spend a day or two.
reviews.title: Good hotel, typical for a Hyatt Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the end of September before a cruise. Arrived at the airport and proceeded to the kiosk for hotel shuttle phones. A short wait, and we were delivered by a friendly driver to the Hyatt Place in their complimentary shuttle.
reviews.title: Looking for a pre-cruise stay? Recommended!!!!!

reviews.text: We arrived with a full shuttle, so check-in took a little, but the personal service that everyone was receiving made it worthwhile. The property is clean, up to date, conveniently located near restaurants and shopping, and the on-property bar was a plus. The breakfast was good for a self-serve style complimentary breakfast.
reviews.title: I forgot my Samsung S4 and we found it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean and modern.
reviews.title: Dream Trip

reviews.text: The staff was friendly, and knowledgable about the area and things to do.
reviews.title: Good place to stay, some problems

reviews.text: Although we were told by others that a cab would be more convenient and cost less, we signed up for the shuttle to the port that is provided on-site by an outside contractor for $7 each person. Because the port was so busy when we arrived, we waited in traffic for quite a while trying to get to the cruise terminal drop off area. I mention this because a couple that I talked to who took a cab were charged a fee for every minute they sat in traffic waiting to get to the drop off point at the terminal. When it was all said and done, they paid the same amount for 2 people in a cab as we did for 4 people in the shuttle.
reviews.title: 2nd time at a Hyatt Place, it wont be my last!

aka: Hyatt Place Ft. Lauderdale Airport - North Hotel
description: Newly Renovated Hyatt Place Ft. Lauderdale 17th Street Convention Center ~ great location, conviently located 2 miles from the beach, 1 mile from the Ft. Lauderdale International Airport and Port Everglades Cruise Port. In addition, we are less than 1 mile from the Ft. Lauderdale Convention Center. We offer a complimentary shuttle within a 3 mile radius and provide complimentary Airport pick and drop off, a complimentay upgraded "hot AM Skillet" breakfast buffet, and 24 hour food cooked to order food options, or grab and go. We are within walking distance to Harbor Shops, Mezzaluna, and Outback to name a few.
